data.title: Matt LeBlanc
data.meta_description: Bio: Celebrity's Most Common Full Name (born Matthew Steven LeBlanc in Newton Massachusetts, on July, 25, 1967) is an American actor, comedian, and producer. Matt's first gig was in a 1987 Heinz Tomato Ketchup commercial.
data.text:
Bio:

Celebrity’s Most Common Full Name (born Matthew Steven LeBlanc in Newton Massachusetts, on July, 25, 1967) is an American actor, comedian, and producer. Matt’s first gig was in a 1987 Heinz Tomato Ketchup commercial. Just one year later he starred in the television drama TV 101 for a single season. He went on to star in Top of the Heap, a spin-off of Married… with children. However, the Fox series only lasted seven episodes airing in April and May 1991. Matt caught his big break as Joey Tribbiani on the hit sitcom Friends. The show ran for 10 years but Matt played Joey for a total of 12, as he starred in a spin-off of Friends called Joey from 2004 to 2006. Matt has also appeared in the films Lookin’ Italian (1994), Ed (1996), Lost in Space (1998), Charlie’s Angels (2000), and All the Queen’s Men (2001). In 2012 Matt won a Golden Globe for Best Actor in a TV Series Comedy for his performance in Episodes. Episodes, a BBC/Showtime television series, was a show that Matt started appearing in in 2011. On the show he played a fictional version of himself. In 2015 Matt appeared in Taylor Swift’s 1989 World Tour during her performance of her hit single “Style.” He appeared onstage along with Sean O’Pry and Chris Rock.

Best Known For:

Matt LeBlanc is best known for his role of Joey Tribbiani on the NBC sitcom Friends, that aired from 1994 to 2004.
